member.name: P:Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.BusinessOperationManagedBase.Process
member.summary: A object representing a managed operation in which the Business Operation is executed.
member.remarks:
The property is always not null and returns a instance.
If the property is read before invoking either or , property's value is instance of object. Its value is defined by return value of the virtual method. This approach avoids checks for null in your code when you access the property. Checks for null would be needed because either or methods do not initialize the property but can also be invoked.
If the property is read after invoking either or , its value is initialized with value returned by the virtual method.

member.name: T:Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.Controllers.BOExecViewControllerEvents
member.summary: Contains all events which can be raised by .

member.name: E:Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.Controllers.BOExecViewControllerEvents.ContextPropertyInitializing
member.summary: Occurs before a Business Operation Context Property to be initialized.

remarks.para: This event is raised when an end-user performs a Context Business Operation.
You may handle the event to initialize the Context Property of the current Business Operation. In this case set the handler's parameter to true.

member.name: E:Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.Controllers.BOExecViewControllerEvents.BusinessOperationExecuting
member.summary: Occurs before a Business Operation to be executed.

remarks.para: This event is raised when an end-user performs a regular or context Business Operation.
You may handle the event to cancel execution of the current Business Operation. For this purpose, set the handler's parameter to true.
You may handle the event customize a Business Operation's parameters.

member.name: E:Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.Controllers.BOExecViewControllerEvents.BusinessOperationCustomExecute
member.summary: Occurs when a Business Operation is executed.

remarks.para: This event is raised when an end-user performs a regular or context Business Operation.
In event handler you may perform a custom execute a Business Operation. In this case you should set the handler's parameter to true to prevent default behavior.
If custom event handler is used you should call the method in the handler to customize result view if necessary.

member.name: E:Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.Controllers.BOExecViewControllerEvents.ProcessResult
member.summary: May occurs after a Business Operation has been executed.

remarks.para: This event is raised after an end-user performs a regular or context Business Operation and result view may be shown.
In event handler you may create custom View which will be shown after execution of a Business Operation.

member.name: E:Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.Controllers.BOExecViewControllerEvents.CreateCustomBusinessOperationInstance
member.summary: Occurs when creating a Business Operation instance to be executed by a .
member.remarks: Handle this event to create a Business Operation, if you need to use some custom constructor, as example. Assign the property with the created object.

member.name: T:Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.Controllers.BORefreshController
member.summary: The logic controller is intended to refresh the object(s) represented by the current View after executing a Context Business Operation.
member.remarks:
Data refresh on context views is not performed by default. Changing this default behaviour can be performed by set the AutoRefreshView property value of the "Application\Xafari\{business_operation}" application model node of appropriate business operations. The AutoRefreshView property can have the following values:
Value Description
Any Data is refreshed on all types of context views - Detail View and List View.
DetailView Data is refreshed on a context Detail View.
ListView Data is refreshed on a context List View.
None The default value. Data is not refreshed.
With attribute, you can specify the initial value of AutoRefreshView for any Business Operation:
[ModelDefault("AutoRefreshView", "DetailView")] public class MyBusinessOperation : BusinessOperationBase {...}

member.name: M:Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.Controllers.BORefreshController.RefreshBeforeExecuteCore(Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.BusinessOperationExecutingEventArgs)
member.summary: Refreshes the context View before executing a Business Operation.
member.remarks: Refresh is necessary for proper operation of the modified context object.

member.name: M:Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.Controllers.BORefreshController.RefreshAfterExecuteCore(Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.ProcessResultEventArgs)
member.summary: Refreshes the context View after executing a Business Operation.

member.name: M:Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.Controllers.BORefreshController.Matches(Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.IBusinessOperation)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified Business Operation suitable for the current view.
member.param: A Business Operation instance.
member.returns: True if the specified Business Operation is suitable for the current view.

member.name: M:Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.Controllers.BORefreshController.RefreshView(Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.IBusinessOperation,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Refreshes the current context view if neccessary.
member.param: A Business Operation instance.
If need to force refresh the not modified object, set the parameter to true. When parameter is set to False the not modified object is not refreshed.
member.returns: False if a Business Operation should be canceled.

member.name: M:Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.Controllers.BORefreshController.RefreshViewCore(Xafari.BC.BusinessOperations.IBusinessOperation,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Refreshes the context View.
